widget.tooltip: Enter a password and click on Check Password to know whether it is black listed.
widget.help: This box lets you enter one password to know whether it is blacklisted in this current Snap! Websites installation. Since the database of blacklisted password is common to all the websites installed on a cluster, only the top website administrator has access to this page.

widget.tooltip: Drag and drop, or use the Browse button, to upload a file of passwords. The file must be a list of passwords, one per line.

help.p: This widgets lets you drag and drop any number of files to quickly add passwords to the database. A file must be composed of one password per line. A line ends with any number of newline and carriage return characters. Empty lines are ignored. We do not support any kind of comments since some password may start with a '#' character or any other comment line starter.
We offer one really large password file in the password plugin. This file gets installed automatically so you do not have to do anything about it.

widget.tooltip: Enter one password per line and then click Add Passwords. Re-adding the same password multiple times has no specific effects and thus it is safe.
widget.help: This widget allows one to quickly add passwords manually without having to create a file to upload.

widget.tooltip: You may have your favorite password listed in the password blacklist. This option gives you the possibility to remove the password from the list. It is, obviously, not recommended to remove any blacklisted passwords unless some were added by mistake.
widget.help: This box lets you enter one or more password (one password per line) and then click on the Remove Password button. You should not remove passwords unless, somehow, some were added to the blacklist by mistake.
